questions.question: What is the primary purpose of pre-briefing in a simulation session?
options: To evaluate the final performance of students.
To provide orientation, set expectations, and establish psychological safety.
To execute the clinical scenario with high fidelity.
To conduct a final reflection on learning outcomes.

questions.question: Which of the following is a key component of the "Scenario Execution" phase?
options: Students making independent decisions and responding to patient cues

questions.question: What is the final step in the step-by-step guide for designing simulation activities?
According to the notes, what is a suggested solution for addressing the "Assessment Complexity" challenge in simulation?
options: Use structured rubrics and multi-source feedback.

questions.question: In the sample scenario "Managing a Patient with Acute Respiratory Distress," what is one of the listed objectives?
Which of the following is an ethical consideration specifically mentioned for simulation design?
options: Ensuring simulations reflect diverse patient populations.
Limiting scenarios to common diseases only.

questions.question: Which driver of change in nursing education is described as transforming how students interact with content through AI, VR, and AR?
What is a core characteristic of Competency-Based Education (CBE)?
options: Students progress based on time spent in class.
Students progress upon demonstrating mastery of skills.
It relies exclusively on traditional lectures.
It eliminates all clinical practice requirements.

questions.question: Which future teaching strategy involves incorporating game elements like points and levels to boost engagement?
What is a primary role of the future nurse educator described as a "Data-Informed Mentor"?
options: Using analytics to track student progress and personalize support.
Conducting all lessons via virtual reality.
Eliminating the use of all digital tools.

questions.question: Which benefit of future-oriented strategies is described as "AI and analytics tailor content to individual needs"?
What is the ethical concern paired with the challenge of the "Digital Divide"?
options: Loss of human connection in teaching.

questions.question: What is a recommended action for educators to prepare for the future, according to the text?
options: Engage in continuous professional development on emerging tools.

questions.question: What is the simplified definition of "Green Nursing" provided in the notes?
options: Nursing that uses only digital records.
Caring for people and the planet by using eco-friendly practices in healthcare.
A nursing specialty focused on outdoor emergency care.
The exclusive use of green-colored medical supplies.

questions.question: Why is Green Nursing considered important?
options: It increases the use of single-use plastics.
Healthcare creates a lot of waste, and Green Nursing helps reduce pollution and save money.
It focuses only on saving money, not the environment.
It is a mandatory legal requirement in all countries.

questions.question: Which of the following is an example role of a nurse in promoting Green Nursing?
options: Always using disposable items for convenience.
Recycling properly by separating medical waste from regular trash.
Leaving lights and equipment on for quick access.
Using the strongest chemical cleaners available.

questions.question: Which emerging strategy involves "short, focused learning modules accessible via smartphones"?
What is the vision for the future of nursing education described as, beyond being digital?
options: Human-centered, globally connected, and ethically grounded.
Focused on reducing the number of nursing students.

questions.question: Which challenge is associated with the ethical concern of "AI Bias"?
In a Flipped Classroom model, what do students typically do during class time?
options: Listen to lectures for new theory.
Engage in discussion, application, and interactive activities.

questions.question: What is a benefit of using Virtual Reality (VR) in nursing education?
options: It eliminates the need for any physical practice.
It allows students to practice procedures in a fully immersive environment.
It is the cheapest available technology.

questions.question: Which global issue has highlighted the need for culturally competent, globally aware nurses?
options: Standardization of all medical practices worldwide.

questions.question: What is the suggested solution for the ethical challenge of "Over-reliance on Tech"?
options: Balance digital tools with interpersonal engagement.

questions.question: According to the text, what is shifting in educational philosophy?
options: From practical focus to theoretical focus only.

questions.question: What does the "Facilitator of Innovation" role for a nurse educator involve?
options: Adopting and integrating new technologies into teaching.

questions.question: In simulation-based learning, debriefing occurs before the scenario execution to prepare students.
Augmented Reality (AR) overlays digital information onto real-world settings to enhance training.
The primary goal of Green Nursing is to increase the use of single-use plastic items in hospitals.
A key driver of change in nursing education is the evolving need to care for aging populations and manage chronic diseases.
In Competency-Based Education (CBE), student progression is based solely on the number of hours spent in clinical practice.
